Point.name: Point

classMethods.name: fromObject
classMethods.summary: Convert any point-compatible object to a {Point}.
classMethods.description: Convert any point-compatible object to a {Point}.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: This can be an object that's already a {Point}, in which case it's simply returned, or an array containing two {Number}s representing the row and column.

arguments.name: copy
arguments.description: An optional boolean indicating whether to force the copying of objects that are already points.

returnValues.description: Returns: A {Point} based on the given object.

arguments.name: point1
arguments.description: {Point}

arguments.name: point2
arguments.description: {Point}

returnValues.description: Returns the given {Point} that is earlier in the buffer.

instanceMethods.name: constructor
instanceMethods.summary: Construct a {Point} object
instanceMethods.description: Construct a {Point} object

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: {Number} row

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: {Number} column

returnValues.description: Returns a new {Point} with the same row and column.
Returns a new {Point} with the row and column negated.

instanceMethods.name: freeze
instanceMethods.summary: Makes this point immutable and returns itself.
instanceMethods.description: Makes this point immutable and returns itself.

returnValues.description: Returns an immutable version of this {Point}

instanceMethods.name: translate
instanceMethods.summary:
Build and return a new point by adding the rows and columns of
the given point.
instanceMethods.description:
Build and return a new point by adding the rows and columns of
the given point.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} whose row and column will be added to this point's row and column to build the returned point.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Point}.

instanceMethods.name: traverse
instanceMethods.summary:
Build and return a new {Point} by traversing the rows and columns
specified by the given point.
instanceMethods.description:
Build and return a new {Point} by traversing the rows and columns
specified by the given point.

This method differs from the direct, vector-style addition offered by
{::translate}. Rather than adding the rows and columns directly, it derives
the new point from traversing in "typewriter space". At the end of every row
traversed, a carriage return occurs that returns the columns to 0 before
continuing the traversal.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} providing the rows and columns to traverse by.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Point}.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description: Returns `-1` if this point precedes the argument.
Returns `0` if this point is equivalent to the argument.
Returns `1` if this point follows the argument.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this point has the same row
and column as the given {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this point precedes the given
{Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this point precedes or is
equal to the given {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this point follows the given
{Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

arguments.name: other
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this point follows or is
equal to the given {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.
Returns an array of this point's row and column.
Returns an array of this point's row and column.
Returns a string representation of the point.

instanceProperties.name: row
instanceProperties.summary: A zero-indexed {Number} representing the row of the {Point}.
instanceProperties.description: A zero-indexed {Number} representing the row of the {Point}.

instanceProperties.name: column
instanceProperties.summary: A zero-indexed {Number} representing the column of the {Point}.
instanceProperties.description: A zero-indexed {Number} representing the column of the {Point}.

Point.summary: Represents a point in a buffer in row/column coordinates.
Point.description:
Represents a point in a buffer in row/column coordinates.

Every public method that takes a point also accepts a *point-compatible*
{Array}. This means a 2-element array containing {Number}s representing the
row and column. So the following are equivalent:

```coffee
new Point(1, 2)
[1, 2] # Point compatible Array
```

Range.name: Range

classMethods.name: fromObject
classMethods.summary: Convert any range-compatible object to a {Range}.
classMethods.description: Convert any range-compatible object to a {Range}.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: This can be an object that's already a {Range}, in which case it's simply returned, or an array containing two {Point}s or point-compatible arrays.

arguments.name: copy
arguments.description: An optional boolean indicating whether to force the copying of objects that are already ranges.Ëš

returnValues.description: Returns: A {Range} based on the given object.

classMethods.name: deserialize
classMethods.summary: Call this with the result of {Range::serialize} to construct a new Range.
classMethods.description: Call this with the result of {Range::serialize} to construct a new Range.

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: {Array} of params to pass to the {::constructor}

instanceMethods.name: constructor
instanceMethods.summary: Construct a {Range} object
instanceMethods.description: Construct a {Range} object

arguments.name: pointA
arguments.description: {Point} or Point compatible {Array} (default: [0,0])

arguments.name: pointB
arguments.description: {Point} or Point compatible {Array} (default: [0,0])

returnValues.description: Returns a new range with the same start and end positions.
Returns a new range with the start and end positions negated.
Returns a plain javascript object representation of the range.

instanceMethods.name: isEmpty
instanceMethods.summary: Is the start position of this range equal to the end position?
instanceMethods.description: Is the start position of this range equal to the end position?

returnValues.description: Returns a {Boolean}.

Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range starts and ends on
the same row.

instanceMethods.name: getRowCount
instanceMethods.summary: Get the number of rows in this range.
instanceMethods.description: Get the number of rows in this range.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Number}.
Returns an array of all rows in the range.

instanceMethods.name: freeze
instanceMethods.summary:
Freezes the range and its start and end point so it becomes
immutable and returns itself.
instanceMethods.description:
Freezes the range and its start and end point so it becomes
immutable and returns itself.

returnValues.description: Returns an immutable version of this {Range}

arguments.name: otherRange
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}

returnValues.description: Returns a new range that contains this range and the given range.

instanceMethods.name: translate
instanceMethods.summary:
Build and return a new range by translating this range's start and
end points by the given delta(s).
instanceMethods.description:
Build and return a new range by translating this range's start and
end points by the given delta(s).

arguments.name: startDelta
arguments.description: A {Point} by which to translate the start of this range.

arguments.name: endDelta
arguments.description: A {Point} to by which to translate the end of this range. If omitted, the `startDelta` will be used instead.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Range}.

instanceMethods.name: traverse
instanceMethods.summary:
Build and return a new range by traversing this range's start and
end points by the given delta.
instanceMethods.description:
Build and return a new range by traversing this range's start and
end points by the given delta.

See {Point::traverse} for details of how traversal differs from translation.

arguments.name: delta
arguments.description: A {Point} containing the rows and columns to traverse to derive the new range.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Range}.

instanceMethods.name: compare
instanceMethods.summary: Compare two Ranges
instanceMethods.description: Compare two Ranges

arguments.name: otherRange
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description: Returns `-1` if this range starts before the argument or contains it.
Returns `0` if this range is equivalent to the argument.
Returns `1` if this range starts after the argument or is contained by it.

arguments.name: otherRange
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range has the same start
and end points as the given {Range} or range-compatible {Array}.

arguments.name: otherRange
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range starts and ends on
the same row as the argument.

instanceMethods.name: intersectsWith
instanceMethods.summary: Determines whether this range intersects with the argument.
instanceMethods.description: Determines whether this range intersects with the argument.

arguments.name: otherRange
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}

arguments.name: exclusive
arguments.description: {Boolean} indicating whether to exclude endpoints   when testing for intersection. Defaults to `false`.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Boolean}.

arguments.name: otherRange
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}

arguments.name: exclusive
arguments.description: A boolean value including that the containment should be exclusive of endpoints. Defaults to false.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range contains the given
range.

arguments.name: point
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}

arguments.name: exclusive
arguments.description: A boolean value including that the containment should be exclusive of endpoints. Defaults to false.

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range contains the given
point.

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: Row {Number}

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range intersects the
given row {Number}.

arguments.name: startRow
arguments.description: {Number} start row

arguments.name: endRow
arguments.description: {Number} end row

returnValues.description:
Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether this range intersects the
row range indicated by the given startRow and endRow {Number}s.
Returns a string representation of the range.

instanceProperties.name: start
instanceProperties.summary: A {Point} representing the start of the {Range}.
instanceProperties.description: A {Point} representing the start of the {Range}.

instanceProperties.name: end
instanceProperties.summary: A {Point} representing the end of the {Range}.
instanceProperties.description: A {Point} representing the end of the {Range}.

Range.summary: Represents a region in a buffer in row/column coordinates.
Range.description:
Represents a region in a buffer in row/column coordinates.

Every public method that takes a range also accepts a *range-compatible*
{Array}. This means a 2-element array containing {Point}s or point-compatible
arrays. So the following are equivalent:

examples.code:
new Range(new Point(0, 1), new Point(2, 3))
new Range([0, 1], [2, 3])
[[0, 1], [2, 3]] # Range compatible array
examples.raw:
```coffee
new Range(new Point(0, 1), new Point(2, 3))
new Range([0, 1], [2, 3])
[[0, 1], [2, 3]] # Range compatible array
```

TextBuffer.name: TextBuffer

instanceMethods.name: constructor
instanceMethods.summary: Create a new buffer with the given params.
instanceMethods.description: Create a new buffer with the given params.

children.name: load
children.description: A {Boolean}, `true` to asynchronously load the buffer from disk after initialization.

children.name: text
children.description: The initial {String} text of the buffer.

arguments.name: params
arguments.description: {Object} or {String} of text

instanceMethods.name: onWillChange
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback synchronously _before_ the content of the
buffer changes.
instanceMethods.description:
Invoke the given callback synchronously _before_ the content of the
buffer changes.

Because observers are invoked synchronously, it's important not to perform
any expensive operations via this method.

children.name: oldRange
children.description: {Range} of the old text.

children.name: newRange
children.description: {Range} of the new text.

children.name: oldText
children.description: {String} containing the text that was replaced.

children.name: newText
children.description: {String} containing the text that was inserted.

children.name: event
children.description: {Object} with the following keys:

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the buffer changes.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidChange
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback synchronously when the content of the
buffer changes.
instanceMethods.description:
Invoke the given callback synchronously when the content of the
buffer changes.

Because observers are invoked synchronously, it's important not to perform
any expensive operations via this method. Consider {::onDidStopChanging} to
delay expensive operations until after changes stop occurring.

children.name: oldRange
children.description: {Range} of the old text.

children.name: newRange
children.description: {Range} of the new text.

children.name: oldText
children.description: {String} containing the text that was replaced.

children.name: newText
children.description: {String} containing the text that was inserted.

children.name: event
children.description: {Object} with the following keys:

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the buffer changes.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidStopChanging
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback asynchronously following one or more
changes after {::getStoppedChangingDelay} milliseconds elapse without an
additional change.
instanceMethods.description:
Invoke the given callback asynchronously following one or more
changes after {::getStoppedChangingDelay} milliseconds elapse without an
additional change.

This method can be used to perform potentially expensive operations that
don't need to be performed synchronously. If you need to run your callback
synchronously, use {::onDidChange} instead.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the buffer stops changing.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidConflict
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback when the in-memory contents of the
buffer become in conflict with the contents of the file on disk.
instanceMethods.description:
Invoke the given callback when the in-memory contents of the
buffer become in conflict with the contents of the file on disk.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the buffer enters conflict.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidChangeModified
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback the value of {::isModified} changes.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback the value of {::isModified} changes.

children.name: modified
children.description: {Boolean} indicating whether the buffer is modified.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when {::isModified} changes.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidUpdateMarkers
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback when all marker `::onDidChange`
observers have been notified following a change to the buffer.
instanceMethods.description:
Invoke the given callback when all marker `::onDidChange`
observers have been notified following a change to the buffer.

The order of events following a buffer change is as follows:

* The text of the buffer is changed
* All markers are updated accordingly, but their `::onDidChange` observers
  are not notified.
* `TextBuffer::onDidChange` observers are notified.
* `Marker::onDidChange` observers are notified.
* `TextBuffer::onDidUpdateMarkers` observers are notified.

Basically, this method gives you a way to take action after both a buffer
change and all associated marker changes.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called after markers are updated.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidCreateMarker
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback when a marker is created.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback when a marker is created.

children.name: marker
children.description: {Marker} that was created.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when a marker is created.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidChangePath
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback when the value of {::getPath} changes.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback when the value of {::getPath} changes.

children.name: path

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the path changes.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

children.name: encoding

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the encoding changes.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: deleteRows
instanceMethods.summary: Delete the lines associated with the specified row range.
instanceMethods.description:
Delete the lines associated with the specified row range.

If the row range is out of bounds, it will be clipped. If the startRow is
greater than the end row, they will be reordered.

arguments.name: startRow
arguments.description: A {Number} representing the first row to delete.

arguments.name: endRow
arguments.description: A {Number} representing the last row to delete, inclusive.

returnValues.description: Returns the {Range} of the deleted text.

instanceMethods.name: markRange
instanceMethods.summary:
Create a marker with the given range. This marker will maintain
its logical location as the buffer is changed, so if you mark a particular
word, the marker will remain over that word even if the word's location in
the buffer changes.
instanceMethods.description:
Create a marker with the given range. This marker will maintain
its logical location as the buffer is changed, so if you mark a particular
word, the marker will remain over that word even if the word's location in
the buffer changes.

arguments.name: range
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array}

children.name: reversed
children.description: Creates the marker in a reversed orientation. (default: false)

children.name: persistent
children.description: Whether to include this marker when serializing the buffer. (default: true)

children.name: invalidate
children.description:
Determines the rules by which changes to the buffer *invalidate* the marker. (default: 'overlap') It can be any of the following strategies, in order of fragility
* __never__: The marker is never marked as invalid. This is a good choice for
  markers representing selections in an editor.
* __surround__: The marker is invalidated by changes that completely surround it.
* __overlap__: The marker is invalidated by changes that surround the
  start or end of the marker. This is the default.
* __inside__: The marker is invalidated by changes that extend into the
  inside of the marker. Changes that end at the marker's start or
  start at the marker's end do not invalidate the marker.
* __touch__: The marker is invalidated by a change that touches the marked
  region in any way, including changes that end at the marker's
  start or start at the marker's end. This is the most fragile strategy.

arguments.name: properties
arguments.description: A hash of key-value pairs to associate with the marker. There are also reserved property names that have marker-specific meaning.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Marker}.

instanceMethods.name: markPosition
instanceMethods.summary: Create a marker at the given position with no tail.
instanceMethods.description: Create a marker at the given position with no tail.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: {Point} or point-compatible {Array}

arguments.name: properties
arguments.description: This is the same as the `properties` parameter in {::markRange}

returnValues.description: Returns a {Marker}.

instanceMethods.name: getMarkers
instanceMethods.summary: Get all existing markers on the buffer.
instanceMethods.description: Get all existing markers on the buffer.

returnValues.description: Returns an {Array} of {Marker}s.

instanceMethods.name: getMarker
instanceMethods.summary: Get an existing marker by its id.
instanceMethods.description: Get an existing marker by its id.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: {Number} id of the marker to retrieve

returnValues.description: Returns a {Marker}.

instanceMethods.name: findMarkers
instanceMethods.summary: Find markers conforming to the given parameters.
instanceMethods.description:
Find markers conforming to the given parameters.

Markers are sorted based on their position in the buffer. If two markers
start at the same position, the larger marker comes first.

children.name: startPosition
children.description: Only include markers that start at the given {Point}.

children.name: endPosition
children.description: Only include markers that end at the given {Point}.

children.name: containsPoint
children.description: Only include markers that contain the given {Point}, inclusive.

children.name: containsRange
children.description: Only include markers that contain the given {Range}, inclusive.

children.name: startRow
children.description: Only include markers that start at the given row {Number}.

children.name: endRow
children.description: Only include markers that end at the given row {Number}.

children.name: intersectsRow
children.description: Only include markers that intersect the given row {Number}.

arguments.name: params
arguments.description: A hash of key-value pairs constraining the set of returned markers. You can query against custom marker properties by listing the desired key-value pairs here. In addition, the following keys are reserved and have special semantics:

returnValues.description: Returns an {Array} of {Marker}s.

instanceMethods.name: getMarkerCount
instanceMethods.summary: Get the number of markers in the buffer.
instanceMethods.description: Get the number of markers in the buffer.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Number}.

instanceMethods.name: undo
instanceMethods.summary: Undo the last operation. If a transaction is in progress, aborts it.
instanceMethods.description: Undo the last operation. If a transaction is in progress, aborts it.

instanceMethods.name: redo
instanceMethods.summary: Redo the last operation
instanceMethods.description: Redo the last operation

instanceMethods.name: transact
instanceMethods.summary: Batch multiple operations as a single undo/redo step.
instanceMethods.description:
Batch multiple operations as a single undo/redo step.

Any group of operations that are logically grouped from the perspective of
undoing and redoing should be performed in a transaction. If you want to
abort the transaction, call {::abortTransaction} to terminate the function's
execution and revert any changes performed up to the abortion.

arguments.name: groupingInterval
arguments.description: The {Number} of milliseconds for which this transaction should be considered 'open for grouping' after it begins. If a transaction with a positive `groupingInterval` is committed while the previous transaction is still open for grouping, the two transactions are merged with respect to undo and redo.

arguments.name: fn
arguments.description: A {Function} to call inside the transaction.

instanceMethods.name: clearUndoStack
instanceMethods.summary: Clear the undo stack.
instanceMethods.description: Clear the undo stack.

instanceMethods.name: createCheckpoint
instanceMethods.summary:
Create a pointer to the current state of the buffer for use
with {::revertToCheckpoint} and {::groupChangesSinceCheckpoint}.
instanceMethods.description:
Create a pointer to the current state of the buffer for use
with {::revertToCheckpoint} and {::groupChangesSinceCheckpoint}.

returnValues.description: Returns a checkpoint value.

instanceMethods.name: revertToCheckpoint
instanceMethods.summary:
Revert the buffer to the state it was in when the given
checkpoint was created.
instanceMethods.description:
Revert the buffer to the state it was in when the given
checkpoint was created.

The redo stack will be empty following this operation, so changes since the
checkpoint will be lost. If the given checkpoint is no longer present in the
undo history, no changes will be made to the buffer and this method will
return `false`.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether the operation succeeded.

instanceMethods.name: groupChangesSinceCheckpoint
instanceMethods.summary:
Group all changes since the given checkpoint into a single
transaction for purposes of undo/redo.
instanceMethods.description:
Group all changes since the given checkpoint into a single
transaction for purposes of undo/redo.

If the given checkpoint is no longer present in the undo history, no
grouping will be performed and this method will return `false`.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether the operation succeeded.

instanceMethods.name: scan
instanceMethods.summary:
Scan regular expression matches in the entire buffer, calling the
given iterator function on each match.
instanceMethods.description:
Scan regular expression matches in the entire buffer, calling the
given iterator function on each match.

If you're programmatically modifying the results, you may want to try
{::backwardsScan} to avoid tripping over your own changes.

children.name: range
children.description: The {Range} of the match.

children.name: stop
children.description: Call this {Function} to terminate the scan.

children.name: replace
children.description: Call this {Function} with a {String} to replace the match.

arguments.name: iterator
arguments.description: A {Function} that's called on each match with an {Object} containing the following keys:

instanceMethods.summary: Get the range for the given row

instanceMethods.name: characterIndexForPosition
instanceMethods.summary:
Convert a position in the buffer in row/column coordinates to an
absolute character offset, inclusive of line ending characters.
instanceMethods.description:
Convert a position in the buffer in row/column coordinates to an
absolute character offset, inclusive of line ending characters.

The position is clipped prior to translating.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: A {Point}.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Number}.

instanceMethods.name: positionForCharacterIndex
instanceMethods.summary:
Convert an absolute character offset, inclusive of newlines, to a
position in the buffer in row/column coordinates.
instanceMethods.description:
Convert an absolute character offset, inclusive of newlines, to a
position in the buffer in row/column coordinates.

The offset is clipped prior to translating.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: A {Number}.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Point}.

instanceMethods.name: clipRange
instanceMethods.summary: Clip the given range so it starts and ends at valid positions.
instanceMethods.description:
Clip the given range so it starts and ends at valid positions.

For example, the position `[1, 100]` is out of bounds if the line at row 1 is
only 10 characters long, and it would be clipped to `(1, 10)`.

arguments.name: range
arguments.description: A {Range} or range-compatible {Array} to clip.

returnValues.description:
Returns the given {Range} if it is already in bounds, or a new clipped
{Range} if the given range is out-of-bounds.

instanceMethods.name: clipPosition
instanceMethods.summary: Clip the given point so it is at a valid position in the buffer.
instanceMethods.description:
Clip the given point so it is at a valid position in the buffer.

For example, the position (1, 100) is out of bounds if the line at row 1 is
only 10 characters long, and it would be clipped to (1, 10)

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: A {Point} or point-compatible {Array}.

returnValues.description:
Returns a new {Point} if the given position is invalid, otherwise returns
the given position.

TextBuffer.summary:
A mutable text container with undo/redo support and the ability to
annotate logical regions in the text.

A mutable text container with undo/redo support and the ability to
annotate logical regions in the text.
